lines.text: His reactions are 33 percent passive, 67 percent aggressive

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: I have no complaints.
script-lines.timeout: I can put a smile on my face if it will make you all feel more comfortable.

lines.text: My only complaints are that I never hear my daughter. What is wrong with her?
Just look at her. I wish she was more like me.
Words are power, I really hope my sister will use them more.
She must know Silent moments are the noisiest moments in our family.
I hear her words, but in her voice I hear nothing but complaints.
She is probably thinking that our daughter doesn't like her food.
But I donâ€™t want to get angry again. I just want one nice dinner with my family.
I cannot tell if everything here is what it is or what it isn't
are they looking at me because I did something wrong? or maybe they are not looking at me at all?
my mind often leads me into false analysis

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: And you daughter, do you like the food?
script-lines.timeout: Daughter, I want to understand if you like the food.

lines.text: she is stressing me out so much, it's exactly what we ate last night.

script-lines.timeout: Never heard such a flat answer.

script-lines.text: Sister, When I look at our Mother I see the perfect sun-

lines.text: I do not understand what he is trying to say

script-lines.text: Well said.

script-lines.text: I am confused but okay. Something is starting to take shape in my mind.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: If your mother had asked me, I would have said that she is the love of my life.
script-lines.timeout: Your mother is the dream itself. the dream of us melting in the sun.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Yes, anything can happen if you let it.

lines.text: So much time passed since we last touch each other
I wonder if she will finally let me hold her hand for a bit?
I want to hold my mother's hand. Would she even let me?
It is been a while since I felt something toward him.
What he just said got me very emotional, I feel I want to hold his hand.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: My woman, how was your day?
script-lines.timeout: My wife? Did you have a good day? I tried to call and you didn't answer.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: A very lovely day, couldn't be better. And yours?
script-lines.timeout: How was your day?

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: I had such a fantastic day, so much rain. Kids, how was school?
script-lines.timeout: Children, did you have fun at school?

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: All day I thought to myself what a wonderful world.
script-lines.timeout: Yes! I saw trees of green, red roses too.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Mother, father, brother you are so beautiful-
script-lines.timeout: Family, you are super beautiful!

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: When you play yourself happy. Beyond the shadow of a dream!
script-lines.timeout: When you act happy! Without a doubt!

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: That is true.
script-lines.timeout: Very accurate.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Do you think she can tell what is true?

script-lines.text: Any dream is a process of active paranoiac thought-

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: leading to the total disappearance-

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: of the world of our reality.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: It is not her fault mother.

lines.text: They see right through me. This is going to be an adventure.

or just fragmented thoughts, full of jump cuts and distortion.

or just fragmented thoughts, full of jump cuts and distortion.

or just fragmented thoughts, full of jump cuts and distortion.

script-lines.text: Time has stopped.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Mother, this looks delicious! what are we having tonight?
script-lines.timeout: I need you to tell me what are we eating.

lines.text: His readings are showing 78 percent ambiguity.
And because our eyes deceive us I can tell him whatever I feel like.
Am I centering my attention on the food because there is something else in this room that I don't want to see?

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Mother, that sounds very deep.
script-lines.timeout: You are a deep person, mother.

script-lines.speaker: sister

script-lines.timeout: A bowl is a deep object.

lines.text: I mean the bowl that is right there on the counter.
I will go now and bring it to the table.
Does my food remind her of a bowl of soup?
I meant much deeper than that, because the food of our mother reminds me of the end of time.
it makes me think about where i came from, and fear what exists at the end of it all.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Your vision is too shallow to my taste, dear sister.
script-lines.timeout: Again, it is all matter of perspective.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: I don't care about the taste of our dinners.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: I mean the memories we are boiling in our soups.
script-lines.timeout: I mean memories that tensing our dinners.

lines.text: One day there was a dog that was locked outside.
She barked so loud and made a lot of noise.
So I just went outside and let her drink from this bowl.
Or maybe it was me, it is hard to remember. I think it was a very cold day.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: It is indeed a very nice bowl. Let me look at it.

lines.text: You eat what you have cooked and you need to finish it to the end, even if it is vomit.
I know she loves another, but I will stay with her and not let go.
Even just for these moments like we had with this bowl by the beach.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Here you go son, take it from me.
script-lines.timeout: Take it son, but don't drop it.

lines.text: oh, my mother is always so careful about this bowl.
Once I almost dropped it, I felt like the bowl itself drops through my throat and into my stomach.
It filled me with an infinite anxiety, fearing from her eyes and from his hands.
I have been avoiding touching it ever since.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Mother, take it from me.
script-lines.timeout: Mother take it from me quickly, please!

lines.text: We got this bowl to our wedding as a gift from his parents.
I remember how his mom hugged me and kissed me that day.
It was the first time in my life that I felt like I belong.
I always liked this bowl more than I ever liked my mother.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: It's a nice bowl. But there is only one way to remember it.
script-lines.timeout: No need to complicate things, it is clear how you should remember it.

script-lines.text: There is? Can you tell me how?
script-lines.timeout: How should I? Tell me, mother.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: It is a bowl of soup.
script-lines.timeout: A bowl of soup is a bowl of soup.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Oh, I thought you hate it when everything is so flat-

script-lines.text: that we should always see both sides.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Yes, the right side and the wrong side.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: I am trying to improve for you. To get rid of the distorted image I have of you.
script-lines.timeout: I want to get better for you, to not see you so distorted.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: You are overreacting, don't be so emotional.
script-lines.timeout: You are too sensitive.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: I told you already, you need to see us exactly as we are.
script-lines.timeout: As we said before, you need to see us.

lines.text: It is hard not to be emotional when they all seem so ugly to me

script-lines.text: So which side does my anger come from?
script-lines.timeout: But from where does my anger come?

lines.text: I was wondering the same thing, although I wish I wasn't.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: From your left side.

lines.text: 85 percent of the time there is someone who is triggering you.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Did you mean my left side?
script-lines.timeout: I think you meant from my left side.

lines.text: I am refusing to be the only one to blame.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: And from your other side - do you see the ocean?
script-lines.timeout: On your other left - can you see an ocean?

lines.text: I usually do not notice what exists in front of me.
Most likely it comes from deep, deep inside of you.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: The ocean? Usually, I notice it every day.

lines.text: What kind of life exists beyond the ocean? If I could would I choose a different family?

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: I see nothing but a collage of moving images from our past.
script-lines.timeout: This ocean is your creation, sister.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: True, but I keep observing you, craving to learn who you are-

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Only your shadows keep coming alive, telling me a different story.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: And what is the story they are telling you?

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: A better story than what exists in front of me. Happy moments of what I believe is you.

lines.text: When those moments really happen, believe me, you will notice them.
For that I might need some wine, I will go bring the bottle from the counter.
Daddy please do not leave me here alone.
What kind of life exists beyond the ocean? If I could would I start over?
I can see there are ships, they look so distant.
when their faces are not talking to me they seem to be smiling.
If I will move glasses boats will sail, I wish they would take you with them father.

script-lines.text: Finally, we are dining quietly.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: We got wet from the wind, a family on the edge of a cliff screaming from joy.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: It is easy to get fooled by the unstable shifts of the wind.

lines.text: My inside and outside have no border between them.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Sister, you are taking us down to a moonless dark night.
script-lines.timeout: I am not a fan of the dark.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Would you like to have some rose water?

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: I don't see any.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Because there isn't any.

script-lines.speaker: mom

lines.text: Why are the glasses not in the right place?
I have to arrange them back in the right order.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Isn't it a matter of perspective? I'm just trying to understand what makes us a family.
script-lines.timeout: I am trying to hold on what keeps us together.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Dear child, we never got there.
script-lines.timeout: Oh, I think you know something is off.

lines.text: Distant siren.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: And what if the ocean dries up? And all you are left with is desert?

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Without your shadows will you leave us behind?

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: No, I need you to set the lowest standard.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Next time I will make sure to smile.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: When you close your eyes what do you see?
script-lines.timeout: Try to close your eyes. What do you see?

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: All the faces that went through me.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: So have no fear of perfection - you will never get it.
script-lines.timeout: So expect errors - you will never be perfect.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: And you cannot see what makes your own shadow.

script-lines.text: Let me turn on the light.

lines.text: What is there light for? if not to say something about our own shadows.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Sister, stop fooling us. We are all hungry and thirsty for concrete images.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: My love, my girl, what is this all made of?

script-lines.timeout: Daddy, This is a dinner made of the best of me - apples, worms, dreams.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: Oh yes, dreams. I am so tired.
script-lines.timeout: The best time of the day has arrived.

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Apples become our liberation-

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Worms turn into our desperation-

script-lines.speaker: brother
script-lines.text: Dreams to longing after your own happiness.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Which one of those am I?
script-lines.timeout: Who am I?

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: You are longing after your own happiness.
script-lines.timeout: This is not about us.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Trapped in the flow of your own thoughts.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: The clock has stopped.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Daddy? Can I ask you something?
script-lines.timeout: Daddy, I promise only one question.

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Sure you can my little pumpkin.
script-lines.timeout: You can try to ask me anything.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: Why are there families at all and not nothing?
script-lines.timeout: Why do we need a family at all?

script-lines.speaker: dad
script-lines.text: Oh, that is a tricky one, Mother?
script-lines.timeout: I am sure your mother has a better answer.

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: They keep you from getting lost in the noise.
script-lines.timeout: There is just too much noise, everywhere, all the time.

script-lines.speaker: sister
script-lines.text: What ground do families come from?
script-lines.timeout: From where do families come from?

script-lines.speaker: mom
script-lines.text: From homes, like this one.
